flawed_nl_solution:
Abe is spending a third of his budget on food, so he spends $3000 / 3 = $<<3000/3=100>>100 on food.
He spends a quarter of his budget on restaurant supplies, so he spends $3000 / 4 = $<<3000/4=750>>750 on supplies.
Thus, he spends $3000 - $100 - $750 = $<<3000-100-750=2150>>2150 on employee wages every month.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1000.0, not 100.0. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
